title: New: Esbern Snare – Troglodyte
body:
I’m deeply curious as to the meaning behind the word _Troglodyte_.

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Troglodyte) brings up several articles, each slightly more outlandish, perplexing and ‘niche’ than the one before. Whatever the meaning, this stunning debut track from Virginia Beach’s **Esbern Snare** is equally as enchanting as it’s subject matter, and a more than impressive first outing. Fusing post-rock inspirations (Sigur Rós, God Is An Astronaut etc.) with the delicate, alluring vocals of lead singer Luke Jones, it’s as beautiful instrumentally as it is vocally. A questions of numerous questions, the majority of them unanswered, Troglodyte is a product of despair, existing somewhere amidst the caverns of desolation.

_And you stand in the fields with your Father, and you ask how could this be real? There were days when it seemed you were nowhere, have I lost all sense of feel?_
